FuncDef:
The remote-mep mep-id command configures an RMEP in an MA.
The undo remote-mep mep-id command deletes an RMEP from an MA.
By default, no RMEP is configured in an MA.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of an RMEP.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 8191.

Specifies the MAC address of an RMEP.
The value is a 12-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of H-H-H. Each H is 4 digits. If an H contains fewer than 4 digits, the left-most digits are padded with zeros. For example, e0 is displayed as 00e0.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
CFM monitors the connectivity of a link between a MEP and an RMEP. The mep mep-id command configures a local MEP. The remote-mep command configures an RMEP in the same MA as the local MEP.
The RMEP configurations supported in various access scenarios are the same as MEP configurations
Prerequisites
An MD and an MA have been configured using the cfm md and ma commands, respectively.
Follow-up Procedure
Run the remote-mep ccm-receive enable command to enable the local MEP to receive CCMs from the RMEP.
Precautions
Before modifying the bridge MAC address of an RMEP, delete the RMEP from an MA and reconfigure the RMEP.
If there are multiple MEPs in an MA, an RMEP corresponds to multiple MEPs when the RMEP is configured.If there is a single MEP in an MA, one or more RMEPs correspond to the single MEP when one or more RMEPs are configured.
The RMEP ID must be different from the MEP ID configured on a local interface.
